meanings.sent1: After the storm, the sailors were revictualing their ship with fresh food.

meanings.sent4: The teacher revictualing her classroom with new books, ready for the new school year.
meanings.sent5: The farmer was revictualing the barn with hay, preparing for the winter months.

meanings.definition: To provide with food or supplies again.
meanings.sent1: The army was revictualing the troops with fresh rations for the upcoming mission.
meanings.sent2: The campers went back to town to revictual their camping gear for the next trip.
meanings.sent3: The family was revictualing their pantry after a big holiday feast.

meanings.sent5: The volunteers were revictualing the shelter with blankets and food for the homeless.
